newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Rotterdam bunkers dip again, majors see weak deman.
newsitem.headline: Rotterdam bunkers dip again, majors see weak deman.

text.p: Rotterdam bunkers dipped by a further $1 as buyers held off, while prices in the rest of Europe were mixed, but little changed.

The Rotterdam bunker market was for once the driving force behind the barge market. Very poor bunker demand meant barge offers declined by $1 a tonne to $84. Bunker quotes were at around $85/$86 fob. Majors said there was plentiful competition for the scarce bids that emerged.
"If the majors are saying there's hardly any demand, then there really is very little indeed," one independent supplier said.
Hamburg bunkers also dipped by around $1 a tonne to quotes of $90 fob.
Mediterranean bunkers were mixed, although prices only varied by around $1. Suppliers in all ports reported the customary pre-weekend lull after some early short covering.
